gov.nih.nlm.ling.sem

Class Indicator

  • java.lang.Object
    • gov.nih.nlm.ling.sem.Indicator
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Ontology, java.lang.Comparable<Indicator>

    public class Indicator
extends java.lang.Object
implements Ontology, java.lang.Comparable<Indicator>
    Represents an abstract, non-textually grounded counterpart to a predicate. An indicator is defined by its lemma (e.g., stimulate, on the other hand) and a list of Senses it encodes (e.g., STIMULATES, AUGMENTS, for stimulate).
    Author:
    Halil Kilicoglu

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static java.util.Comparator<Indicator> LENGTH_ORDER
      Order a set of indicators based on their length, so that larger spans are preferred.

        public static final java.util.Comparator<Indicator> LENGTH_ORDER
        Order a set of indicators based on their length, so that larger spans are preferred.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Indicator

        public Indicator(java.lang.String string,
                 java.util.List<ContiguousLexeme> lexemes,
                 boolean verified,
                 java.util.List<Sense> senses)
        Instantiates an Indicator object with its senses.
        Parameters:
        string - the lemma text
        lexemes - the list of lexemes forming the indicator
        verified - whether this is a verified indicator (internal use)
        senses - the list of senses

      • Indicator

        public Indicator(java.lang.String string,
                 java.util.List<ContiguousLexeme> lexemes,
                 boolean verified,
                 java.util.List<Sense> senses,
                 gov.nih.nlm.ling.sem.Indicator.GapType gt)
        Instantiates an Indicator object with its gap type (NONE, SENTENCE, DISCOURSE). Gap type is relevant when the indicator is a multi-word unit. NONE indicates that no gaps are allowed. SENTENCE indicates that intra-sentence gaps are allowed, DISCOURSE indicates that inter-sentence gaps are allowed.
        Parameters:
        string - the lemma text
        lexemes - the list of lexemes forming the indicator
        verified - whether this is a verified indicator (internal use)
        senses - the list of senses
        gt - the gap type (GapType.NONE, GapType.SENTENCE, or GapType.DISCOURSE)

      • Indicator

        public Indicator(nu.xom.Element el)
        Instantiates an Indicator object from an XML element.
        Parameters:
        el - the XML element representing the indicator
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the element does not conform to indicator XML

        Returns:

      • compareTo

        public int compareTo(Indicator et1)
        To sort in the order of complexity, from less to more complex. An atomic indicator precedes an embedding indicator.
        Specified by:
        compareTo in interface java.lang.Comparable<Indicator>

      • loadIndicatorsFromFile

        public static java.util.LinkedHashSet<Indicator> loadIndicatorsFromFile(java.lang.String fileName,
                                                                        int count)
                                                                 throws java.io.FileNotFoundException,
                                                                        java.io.IOException,
                                                                        nu.xom.ParsingException,
                                                                        nu.xom.ValidityException
        Loads indicators from an XML file. The indicators can be filtered by corpus frequency, if specified in the XML file.
        Parameters:
        fileName - the indicator XML file
        count - the corpus frequency threshold
        Returns:
        the set of indicators in the XML file
        Throws:
        java.io.FileNotFoundException - if the XML file cannot be found
        java.io.IOException - if the XML file cannot be read
        nu.xom.ParsingException - if the XML cannot be parsed
        nu.xom.ValidityException - if the XML is invalid

      • filterVerified

        public static java.util.LinkedHashSet<Indicator> filterVerified(java.util.LinkedHashSet<Indicator> inIndicators)
        Selects verified indicators from a list of indicators. Verified indicators are those that have gone through some kind of quality assurance.
        Parameters:
        inIndicators - the input list of indicators
        Returns:
        the verified indicators

        Parameters:

        Returns:

      • filterOutGappedIndicators

        public static java.util.LinkedHashSet<Indicator> filterOutGappedIndicators(java.util.LinkedHashSet<Indicator> inIndicators)
        Removes gapped indicators from a list of indicators.
        Parameters:
        inIndicators - the input list of indicators
        Returns:
        the single word and contiguous multi-word indicators

      • filterIndicatorsHierarchically

        public static java.util.LinkedHashSet<Indicator> filterIndicatorsHierarchically(java.util.LinkedHashSet<Indicator> inIndicators,
                                                                                java.util.Collection<java.lang.String> embeddingTypes)
        Filters out indicators that do not belong to one of the specified embedding types.
        Parameters:
        inIndicators - the input set of indicators
        embeddingTypes - the embedding types desired
        Returns:
        the indicators belonging to one of the embeddingTypes

      • filterIndicatorsByThreshold

        public static java.util.LinkedHashSet<Indicator> filterIndicatorsByThreshold(java.util.LinkedHashSet<Indicator> inIndicators,
                                                                             double[] thresholds)
        Filters out indicators with probability under a given threshold.

        If no probability is given for an indicator (0.0), it is included in any case. thresholds array keeps the thresholds for atomic, embedding, and discourse indicators, respectively.

        Parameters:
        inIndicators - the input set of indicators
        thresholds - the threshold values for atomic, embedding, and discourse indicators
        Returns:
        the indicators with a higher probability then their respective threshold

      • filterBySourceType

        public static java.util.LinkedHashSet<Indicator> filterBySourceType(java.util.Set<Indicator> inIndicators,
                                                                    java.util.Collection<java.lang.String> types)
        Filters indicators with given types in their source they are extracted from.

        Parameters:
        inIndicators - the input set of indicators
        types - the source types desired
        Returns:
        the indicators with the source types
